Equine FacilitatedConstellations

Fostering authentic connection and collaboration with horses through respectful, distance-based training that honours their natural wisdom and autonomy.

Meet Our Team

Our dedicated professionals bring decades of experience in equine education, constellation work, therapy, and ethical training approaches.

Maria-Lucy Neason

Lead Instructor & Equine Behavior Specialist

Maria-Lucy is a British Horse Society Accredited Professional Coach (Level IV) with over 30 years of experience in the equestrian industry. She holds a Master's degree in Equine Studies and has an extensive background in education.

She is a certified Connection Training coach and is currently undertaking further study with COAPE in the MHERA Licensed Practitioners Course, integrating the latest research in equine ethology, learning theory, and affective neuroscience.

Education

  • • Master's in Equine Studies
  • • BHS Level IV Coach
  • • 15+ years in Higher Ed

Specializations

  • • Connection Training
  • • Equine Ethology
  • • Affective Neuroscience

Ursula Maria Bell

Systemic Constellation Facilitator & Trainer

Ursula is a qualified systemic constellation facilitator, trainer, and supervisor with over 15 years of experience in transgenerational healing. She has facilitated more than 1,000 constellations and works internationally.

German by origin and now based in Bulgaria, she holds a Diploma in Viktor Frankl's Logotherapy and advanced diplomas in Transpersonal Therapy. In 2024, she published her book "In the Spirit of Love and Reconciliation – More than Constellations".

Qualifications

  • • Logotherapy Diploma
  • • Transpersonal Therapy
  • • Counselling Supervision Level VII

Experience

  • • 1,000+ constellations
  • • International trainer
  • • Published author

Kate Bickerstaff

Senior ACCPH Member & Equine-Facilitated Therapist

Kate's practice weaves together equine-facilitated therapy, systemic constellations, and nature-based healing. Her work is rooted in reverence for both human and equine wisdom, guided by her horse Topper since 2012.

As a Senior Member of the ACCPH and Athena-accredited practitioner, Kate has been working in equine-facilitated constellations for six years, co-creating Equillation's unique approach.

Qualifications

  • • BSc (Hons) Psychology
  • • Level 5 Counselling
  • • Equine Facilitated Psychotherapy

Specializations

  • • Constellation Therapy
  • • Reiki & Energy Healing
  • • Nature-based Healing

Our Collaborative Vision

Together, Maria-Lucy, Ursula, and Kate have co-created Equillation—a unique way of working that honours the horse at every step and ensures their needs, freedom, and natural instincts remain central to our practice.

We bring together professional knowledge, spiritual insight, and lived experience to guide both individuals and practitioners on their journeys of growth, connection, and transformation.

Our Philosophy

At the heart of our work lies a deep respect for the horse as a sentient being, an individual with their own thoughts, feelings, and needs.

Honoring Natural Wisdom

Horses can be overlooked, treated as tools or commodities rather than honoured for their natural wisdom and sensitivity. Too often, the subtle and non-verbal language of horses can go unnoticed.

When these quiet signals are overlooked, we miss the chance for deeper connection, mutual respect, and genuine understanding between human and horse.

Deep Respect

For the horse as a sentient being with individual thoughts and feelings

What's Most Important to Us

Natural State

Allowing horses to simply be horses, meeting their basic and complex emotional needs

Authentic Feedback

Regulated horses offer unbiased feedback, reflecting what's present without interference

Freedom of Choice

Horses have the freedom to choose whether to engage, respecting their autonomy

Our Training Approach

Fostering a new way of partnering with horses that honours their natural instincts, freedom, and relationships.

Distance-Based Work

We work from a distance, ensuring that we don't intrude on their lives or disrupt their bonds with one another. This respectful approach maintains the horses' natural state and social connections.

  • Non-intrusive methodology
  • Preserves herd dynamics
  • Maintains natural regulation

Natural Herd Environment

In our Equine Facilitated constellations, the animals remain in their natural state, grazing peacefully among their herd. When horses are with their herd, they are naturally regulated and grounded.

  • Horses remain with their herd
  • Natural grazing continues
  • Connected to true selves

Why This Training Matters

This training is about fostering a new way of partnering with horses, one that honours their natural instincts, freedom, and relationships. By meeting them in their own space and respecting their choices, we create opportunities for authentic connection and collaboration.

In this space, the horses have the freedom to choose whether to engage with the client or not. That choice is vital; it respects their autonomy and creates a more genuine, meaningful interaction.

We share this not to judge other methods but to offer a perspective rooted in respect, connection, and mutual understanding. Our hope is that, together, we can create a future where more practitioners work with horses in a way that truly honours their sentience, allowing them to guide the healing process in their own gentle, powerful way.

Connect With Us

Ready to explore a new way of partnering with horses? We'd love to hear from you.
